newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares blaze on, more record highs ahead.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares blaze on, more record highs ahead.

text.p: The Danish top-20 KFX index finished on Wednesday at an all-time closing high for the third consecutive day with dealers foreseeing more advances ahead dependent on the United States.

"The market was euphoric all morning although it slipped a little in the afternoon. Things bucked up later on with foreign investors in evidence. Tomorrow's picture depends on tonight's Dow Jones and the way the dollar goes," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 1.98 point higher at 145.37, a new closing record, in overall bourse turnover of 2.024 billion crowns, having hit 146.62 at its highest around noon.
The KFX March future rose 1.40 point to 145.25 with 172 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
Second biggest bank Unidanmark was the day's most traded paper with 320,000 shares changing hands to close 12 crowns higher at 358, attracting foreign investors.
Den Danske Bank and BG Bank profited from the wave of interest in local banking paper, putting on 14 and three crowns respectively to end the day at 510 and 310.
